properties.Description: Database Migration Resource properties for CosmosDb for Mongo.

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

targetMongoConnection.Description: Target Cosmos DB Mongo connection details.

collectionList.Description: List of Mongo Collections to be migrated.

scope.Description: Resource Id of the target resource.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning State of migration. ProvisioningState as Succeeded implies that validations have been performed and migration has started.

migrationService.Description: Resource Id of the Migration Service.

migrationFailureError.Description: Error details in case of migration failure.

provisioningError.Description: Error message for migration provisioning failure, if any.

userName.Description: User name to connect to Mongo.

useSsl.Description: Whether to UseSsl or UseTls to connect to Mongo. Default is true.

migrationProgressDetails.Description: Detailed migration status. Not included by default.

createdBy.Description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.Description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.Description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state to track the async operation status.

integrationRuntimeState.Description: Current state of the Integration runtime.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state to track the async operation status.

integrationRuntimeState.Description: Current state of the Integration runtime.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

etag.Description: HTTP strong entity tag value. Ignored if submitted

kind.Description: The resource kind. Only 'vm' (the default) is supported.

publicKey.Description: The public key of the service, used to encrypt secrets sent to the service

virtualSubnetId.Description: The ID of the Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets resource to which the service should be joined

virtualNicId.Description: The ID of the Microsoft.Network/networkInterfaces resource which the service have

autoStopDelay.Description: The time delay before the service is auto-stopped when idle.

deleteResourcesOnStop.Description: Whether service resources should be deleted when stopped. (Turned on by default)

name.Description: The unique name of the SKU, such as 'P3'

tier.Description: The tier of the SKU, such as 'Basic', 'General Purpose', or 'Business Critical'

family.Description: The SKU family, used when the service has multiple performance classes within a tier, such as 'A', 'D', etc. for virtual machines

size.Description: The size of the SKU, used when the name alone does not denote a service size or when a SKU has multiple performance classes within a family, e.g. 'A1' for virtual machines

capacity.Description: The capacity of the SKU, if it supports scaling

etag.Description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

errors.Description: Array of errors. This is ignored if submitted.

state.Description: The state of the task. This is ignored if submitted.

clientData.Description: Key value pairs of client data to attach meta data information to task

code.Description: The machine-readable description of the error, such as 'InvalidRequest' or 'InternalServerError'

message.Description: The human-readable description of the error

details.Description: Inner errors that caused this error

errors.Description: Array of errors. This is ignored if submitted.

state.Description: The state of the command. This is ignored if submitted.

output.Description: Command output. This is ignored if submitted.

errors.Description: List of errors that happened during the command execution

filePath.Description: The path to the file where exception occurred

lineNumber.Description: The line number where exception occurred

hResult.Description: Coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception

output.Description: Command output. This is ignored if submitted.

errors.Description: List of errors that happened during the command execution

objectName.Description: The qualified name of a database or collection to act upon, or null to act upon the entire migration

immediate.Description: If true, replication for the affected objects will be stopped immediately. If false, the migrator will finish replaying queued events before finishing the replication.

objectName.Description: The qualified name of a database or collection to act upon, or null to act upon the entire migration

input.Description: Describes a connection to a MongoDB data source

output.Description: An array containing a single MongoDbClusterInfo object

connectionString.Description: A MongoDB connection string or blob container URL. The user name and password can be specified here or in the userName and password properties

trustServerCertificate.Description: Whether to trust the server certificate

authentication.Description: Authentication type to use for connection

databases.Description: A list of non-system databases in the cluster

supportsSharding.Description: Whether the cluster supports sharded collections

version.Description: The version of the data source in the form x.y.z (e.g. 3.6.7). Not used if Type is BlobContainer.

collections.Description: A list of supported collections in a MongoDB database

supportsSharding.Description: Whether the database has sharding enabled. Note that the migration task will enable sharding on the target if necessary.

averageDocumentSize.Description: The average document size, or -1 if the average size is unknown

dataSize.Description: The estimated total data size, in bytes, or -1 if the size is unknown.

documentCount.Description: The estimated total number of documents, or -1 if the document count is unknown

name.Description: The unqualified name of the database or collection

qualifiedName.Description: The qualified name of the database or collection. For a collection, this is the database-qualified name.

databaseName.Description: The name of the database containing the collection

isCapped.Description: Whether the collection is a capped collection (i.e. whether it has a fixed size and acts like a circular buffer)

isSystemCollection.Description: Whether the collection is system collection

isView.Description: Whether the collection is a view of another collection

shardKey.Description: The shard key on the collection, or null if the collection is not sharded

supportsSharding.Description: Whether the database has sharding enabled. Note that the migration task will enable sharding on the target if necessary.

viewOf.Description: The name of the collection that this is a view of, if IsView is true

averageDocumentSize.Description: The average document size, or -1 if the average size is unknown

dataSize.Description: The estimated total data size, in bytes, or -1 if the size is unknown.

documentCount.Description: The estimated total number of documents, or -1 if the document count is unknown

name.Description: The unqualified name of the database or collection

qualifiedName.Description: The qualified name of the database or collection. For a collection, this is the database-qualified name.

fields.Description: The fields within the shard key

isUnique.Description: Whether the shard key is unique

input.Description: Describes how a MongoDB data migration should be performed

boostRUs.Description: The RU limit on a CosmosDB target that collections will be temporarily increased to (if lower) during the initial copy of a migration, from 10,000 to 1,000,000, or 0 to use the default boost (which is generally the maximum), or null to not boost the RUs. This setting has no effect on non-CosmosDB targets.

databases.Description: The databases on the source cluster to migrate to the target. The keys are the names of the databases.

replication.Description: Describes how changes will be replicated from the source to the target. The default is OneTime.

source.Description: Settings used to connect to the source cluster

target.Description: Settings used to connect to the target cluster

throttling.Description: Settings used to limit the resource usage of the migration

collections.Description: The collections on the source database to migrate to the target. The keys are the unqualified names of the collections.

targetRUs.Description: The RUs that should be configured on a CosmosDB target, or null to use the default, or 0 if throughput should not be provisioned for the database. This has no effect on non-CosmosDB targets.

canDelete.Description: Whether the migrator is allowed to drop the target collection in the course of performing a migration. The default is true.

targetRUs.Description: The RUs that should be configured on a CosmosDB target, or null to use the default. This has no effect on non-CosmosDB targets.

fields.Description: The fields within the shard key

isUnique.Description: Whether the shard key is unique

minFreeCpu.Description: The percentage of CPU time that the migrator will try to avoid using, from 0 to 100

minFreeMemoryMb.Description: The number of megabytes of RAM that the migrator will try to avoid using

maxParallelism.Description: The maximum number of work items (e.g. collection copies) that will be processed in parallel

bytesCopied.Description: The number of document bytes copied during the Copying stage

documentsCopied.Description: The number of documents copied during the Copying stage

elapsedTime.Description: The elapsed time in the format [ddd.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff] (i.e. TimeSpan format)

errors.Description: The errors and warnings that have occurred for the current object. The keys are the error codes.

eventsPending.Description: The number of oplog events awaiting replay

eventsReplayed.Description: The number of oplog events replayed so far

lastEventTime.Description: The timestamp of the last oplog event received, or null if no oplog event has been received yet

lastReplayTime.Description: The timestamp of the last oplog event replayed, or null if no oplog event has been replayed yet

name.Description: The name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the unqualified collection name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

qualifiedName.Description: The qualified name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the database-qualified name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

totalBytes.Description: The total number of document bytes on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total size was unknown

totalDocuments.Description: The total number of documents on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total count was unknown

code.Description: The non-localized, machine-readable code that describes the error or warning

count.Description: The number of times the error or warning has occurred

message.Description: The localized, human-readable message that describes the error or warning

type.Description: The type of error or warning

collections.Description: The progress of the collections in the database. The keys are the unqualified names of the collections

bytesCopied.Description: The number of document bytes copied during the Copying stage

documentsCopied.Description: The number of documents copied during the Copying stage

elapsedTime.Description: The elapsed time in the format [ddd.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff] (i.e. TimeSpan format)

errors.Description: The errors and warnings that have occurred for the current object. The keys are the error codes.

lastReplayTime.Description: The timestamp of the last oplog event replayed, or null if no oplog event has been replayed yet

name.Description: The name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the unqualified collection name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

totalBytes.Description: The total number of document bytes on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total size was unknown

totalDocuments.Description: The total number of documents on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total count was unknown

collections.Description: The progress of the collections in the database. The keys are the unqualified names of the collections

name.Description: The name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the unqualified collection name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

enableSchemaValidation.Description: Allows to compare the schema information between source and target.

enableDataIntegrityValidation.Description: Allows to perform a checksum based data integrity validation between source and target for the selected database / tables .

enableQueryAnalysisValidation.Description: Allows to perform a quick and intelligent query analysis by retrieving queries from the source database and executes them in the target. The result will have execution statistics for executions in source and target databases for the extracted queries.

activeBackupSets.Description: Backup sets that are currently active (Either being uploaded or getting restored)

containerName.Description: Name of container created in the Azure Storage account where backups are copied to

errorPrefix.Description: prefix string to use for querying errors for this database

isFullBackupRestored.Description: Whether full backup has been applied to the target database or not

backupSetId.Description: Id for the set of backup files

firstLsn.Description: First log sequence number of the backup file

lastLsn.Description: Last log sequence number of the backup file

lastModifiedTime.Description: Last modified time of the backup file in share location

backupType.Description: Enum of the different backup types

listOfBackupFiles.Description: List of files in the backup set

databaseName.Description: Name of the database to which the backup set belongs

backupStartDate.Description: Date and time that the backup operation began

backupFinishedDate.Description: Date and time that the backup operation finished

isBackupRestored.Description: Whether the backup set is restored or not

fileLocation.Description: Location of the backup file in shared folder

familySequenceNumber.Description: Sequence number of the backup file in the backup set

status.Description: Status of the backup file during migration

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

isCloneable.Description: whether the task can be cloned or not

createdOn.Description: DateTime in UTC when the task was created

validationOptions.Description:
Options for enabling various post migration validations. Available options, 
 1.) Data Integrity Check: Performs a checksum based comparison on source and target tables after the migration to ensure the correctness of the data. 
 2.) Schema Validation: Performs a thorough schema comparison between the source and target tables and provides a list of differences between the source and target database, 3.) Query Analysis: Executes a set of queries picked up automatically either from the Query Plan Cache or Query Store and execute them and compares the execution time between the source and target database.

startedOn.Description: Date and time relative to UTC when the migration was started on

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Information for connecting to target

targetDatabaseName.Description: Name of target database. Note: Target database will be truncated before starting migration.

makeSourceDbReadOnly.Description: Whether to set database read only before migration

tableMap.Description: Mapping of source to target tables

schemaSetting.Description: Settings selected for DB schema migration.

stage.Description: Migration stage that this database is in

errorPrefix.Description: Wildcard string prefix to use for querying all errors of the item

resultPrefix.Description: Wildcard string prefix to use for querying all sub-tem results of the item

objectSummary.Description: Summary of object results in the migration

dataIntegrityValidationResult.Description: Provides data integrity validation result between the source and target tables that are migrated.

schemaValidationResult.Description: Provides schema comparison result between source and target database

queryAnalysisValidationResult.Description: Results of some of the query execution result between source and target database

status.Description: Current status of validation at the database level

failedObjects.Description: List of failed table names of source and target pair

validationErrors.Description: List of errors that happened while performing data integrity validation

schemaDifferences.Description: List of schema differences between the source and target databases

validationErrors.Description: List of errors that happened while performing schema compare validation

objectName.Description: Name of the object that has the difference

objectType.Description: Type of the object that has the difference. e.g (Table/View/StoredProcedure)

updateAction.Description: Update action type with respect to target

queryResults.Description: List of queries executed and it's execution results in source and target

validationErrors.Description: Errors that are part of the execution

queryText.Description: Query text retrieved from the source server

statementsInBatch.Description: Total no. of statements in the batch

sourceResult.Description: Query analysis result from the source

targetResult.Description: Query analysis result from the target

cpuTimeMs.Description: CPU Time in millisecond(s) for the query execution

elapsedTimeMs.Description: Time taken in millisecond(s) for executing the query

waitStats.Description: Dictionary of sql query execution wait types and the respective statistics

hasErrors.Description: Indicates whether the query resulted in an error

durationInSeconds.Description: Duration of task execution in seconds.

databases.Description: Selected databases as a map from database name to database id

databaseSummary.Description: Summary of database results in the migration

migrationReportResult.Description: Migration Report Result, provides unique url for downloading your migration report.

summaryResults.Description: Validation summary results for each database

status.Description: Current status of validation at the migration level. Status from the database validation result status will be aggregated here.

errorPrefix.Description: Wildcard string prefix to use for querying all errors of the item

resultPrefix.Description: Wildcard string prefix to use for querying all sub-tem results of the item

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Information for connecting to target

ssisStoreType.Description: The SSIS store type of source, only SSIS catalog is supported now in DMS (classic)

projectOverwriteOption.Description: The overwrite option for the SSIS project migration

environmentOverwriteOption.Description: The overwrite option for the SSIS environment migration

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

createdOn.Description: DateTime in UTC when the task was created

isCloneable.Description: whether the task can be cloned or not

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Information for connecting to target

schemaOption.Description: Option on how to migrate the schema

fileId.Description: Resource Identifier of a file resource containing the uploaded schema file

fileName.Description: Name of the file resource containing the uploaded schema file

state.Description: State of the schema migration for this database

stage.Description: Schema migration stage for this database

databaseErrorResultPrefix.Description: Prefix string to use for querying errors for this database

schemaErrorResultPrefix.Description: Prefix string to use for querying schema errors for this database

numberOfSuccessfulOperations.Description: Number of successful operations for this database

numberOfFailedOperations.Description: Number of failed operations for this database

fileId.Description: Identifier for the file resource containing the schema of this database

state.Description: Overall state of the schema migration

input.Description: Input for the service task to check for OCI drivers.

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

serverVersion.Description: Version of the source server to check against.  Optional.

installedDriver.Description: Information about the installed driver if found and valid.

validationErrors.Description: Validation errors

driverName.Description: The name of the driver package

driverSize.Description: The size in bytes of the driver package

archiveChecksum.Description: The MD5 Base64 encoded checksum for the driver package.

oracleChecksum.Description: The checksum for the driver package provided by Oracle.

assemblyVersion.Description: Version listed in the OCI assembly 'oci.dll'

supportedOracleVersions.Description: List of Oracle database versions supported by this driver. Only major minor of the version is listed.

input.Description: Input for the service task to install an OCI driver.

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

driverPackageName.Description: Name of the uploaded driver package to install.

validationErrors.Description: Validation errors

input.Description: Input for the service task to upload an OCI driver.

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

driverShare.Description: File share information for the OCI driver archive.

driverPackageName.Description: The name of the driver package that was validated and uploaded.

validationErrors.Description: Validation errors

input.Description: Describes how a MongoDB data migration should be performed

output.Description: An array containing a single MongoDbMigrationProgress object

databases.Description: The progress of the databases in the migration. The keys are the names of the databases

bytesCopied.Description: The number of document bytes copied during the Copying stage

documentsCopied.Description: The number of documents copied during the Copying stage

elapsedTime.Description: The elapsed time in the format [ddd.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff] (i.e. TimeSpan format)

errors.Description: The errors and warnings that have occurred for the current object. The keys are the error codes.

eventsPending.Description: The number of oplog events awaiting replay

eventsReplayed.Description: The number of oplog events replayed so far

lastEventTime.Description: The timestamp of the last oplog event received, or null if no oplog event has been received yet

lastReplayTime.Description: The timestamp of the last oplog event replayed, or null if no oplog event has been replayed yet

name.Description: The name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the unqualified collection name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

qualifiedName.Description: The qualified name of the progress object. For a collection, this is the database-qualified name. For a database, this is the database name. For the overall migration, this is null.

totalBytes.Description: The total number of document bytes on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total size was unknown

totalDocuments.Description: The total number of documents on the source at the beginning of the Copying stage, or -1 if the total count was unknown

input.Description: Input for the task that migrates Oracle databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL for online migrations

output.Description: An array containing a single validation error response object

validationErrors.Description: Errors associated with a selected database object

output.Description: Task output. This is ignored if submitted.

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Information for connecting to target

backupFileShare.Description: Backup file share information for all selected databases.

backupBlobShare.Description: SAS URI of Azure Storage Account Container to be used for storing backup files.

backupMode.Description: Backup Mode to specify whether to use existing backup or create new backup.

backupFolderErrors.Description: Errors associated with the BackupFolder path

backupShareCredentialsErrors.Description: Errors associated with backup share user name and password credentials

backupStorageAccountErrors.Description: Errors associated with the storage account provided.

existingBackupErrors.Description: Errors associated with existing backup files.

databaseBackupInfo.Description: Information about backup files when existing backup mode is used.

backupFiles.Description: The list of backup files for the current database.

position.Description: Position of current database backup in the file.

isDamaged.Description: Database was damaged when backed up, but the backup operation was requested to continue despite errors.

isCompressed.Description: Whether the backup set is compressed

familyCount.Description: Number of files in the backup set.

backupFinishDate.Description: Date and time when the backup operation finished.

backupFileShare.Description: Backup file share information for all selected databases.

sourceConnectionInfo.Description: Connection information for source SQL Server

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Connection information for Azure SQL Database Managed Instance

azureApp.Description: Azure Active Directory Application the DMS (classic) instance will use to connect to the target instance of Azure SQL Database Managed Instance and the Azure Storage Account

etag.Description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

azureAuthenticationInfo.Description: Field that defines the Azure active directory application info, used to connect to the target Azure resource

creationTime.Description: UTC Date and time when project was created

targetConnectionInfo.Description: Information for connecting to target

managedInstanceResourceId.Description: Resource id for Azure SQL database Managed instance

connectionString.Description: A MongoDB connection string or blob container URL. The user name and password can be specified here or in the userName and password properties

trustServerCertificate.Description: Whether to trust the server certificate

authentication.Description: Authentication type to use for connection

resourceId.Description: Represents the ID of an HTTP resource represented by an Azure resource provider.

trustServerCertificate.Description: Whether to trust the server certificate

etag.Description: HTTP strong entity tag value. This is ignored if submitted.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

extension.Description: Optional File extension. If submitted it should not have a leading period and must match the extension from filePath.

filePath.Description: Relative path of this file resource. This property can be set when creating or updating the file resource.

mediaType.Description: File content type. This property can be modified to reflect the file content type.

additionalProperties.Description: Unmatched properties from the message are deserialized in this collection.

nodeName.Description: Name of the integration runtime node.

availableMemoryInMB.Description: Available memory (MB) on the integration runtime node.

cpuUtilization.Description: CPU percentage on the integration runtime node.

concurrentJobsLimit.Description: Maximum concurrent jobs on the integration runtime node.

concurrentJobsRunning.Description: The number of jobs currently running on the integration runtime node.

maxConcurrentJobs.Description: The maximum concurrent jobs in this integration runtime.

sentBytes.Description: Sent bytes on the integration runtime node.

receivedBytes.Description: Received bytes on the integration runtime node.
